instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't restart, needs power cut completely to turn back on
threads.message:
hi there!
this one had a lot of liquid damage on the SMC area. i have replaced that twice. I can confirm that the lid sensor was also damaged but i fixed that too. now the issue is when i try to restart, i have to cut power completely, unplug battery and DC and plug back in to turn on. if i perform a restart through macOS. it'll stay off but the trackpad will click for a second and then turn off and then click for a second and just cycle like that. other than that the machine works indefinitely

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't restart, needs power cut completely to turn back on
threads.message:
Not sure if I correctly understood.
If you restart from macOS, machine remains in off state?
If you choose shut down from macOS, also remains off and can't turn it on again with power button?
Try using <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads, instead of power button.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't restart, needs power cut completely to turn back on
threads.message: no difference with the pads. I can tell it's bootlooping after being shut down until i completely get rid of power and put power back into it. So essentailly to get it to turn on again i would have to unplug DC and then unplug the battery and plug it all back in. then it will come back on... until i shut it down. Then if i try to turn it on the trackpad will have click for about a second, then stop, then click again. As if it's bootlooping... until i cut all power and start again

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't restart, needs power cut completely to turn back on
threads.message:
What is exact <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> voltage?
Can you turn it on making SMC reset?
Also try in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't restart, needs power cut completely to turn back on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> is 3.371v but the last two digits will fluctuate constantly between 3.365 and 3.380 and <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is 3.41v very steady.

SMC bypass works but thats because power cycling the machine works anyway 

I can use <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> to turn it on but it'll still turn off and on (or at least accoridng to the trackpad feedback) unless i power cycle

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't restart, needs power cut completely to turn back on
threads.message:
Did you try to reset SMC?
[URL unfurl="true"]https://purplecomputing.com/tech-how-to/how-to-reset-the-smc-system-management-controller/[/URL]
